title: Whatever happened to the 60s rock group The Turtles? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Turtles had their run in the late sixties and the band broke up in mid seventies. Two of the original members, Howard Kaylan & Mark Volman were friends and started a band together in high school. Went pro under the name ‘Flo & Eddie” and then formed the Turtles and carried that on until the mid-seventies. After “The Turtles” and they then became members of gifted guitarist and social commenter, Frank Zappa’s band. Associated with Zappa for the next several years. After Zappa, they became backing vocals for early “progressive glam” joining rocker Marc Bolan’s “T. Rex” as supporting vocalists. Late seventies, they left T. Rex and went on the “old bands tour” for several years through into late 90’s. Their fan based aged out and have retired from the “music performance world”.

The original Turtles split up in 1970 and the two front men, Mark Volman and Howard Kaylan, joined Frank Zappa’s band the Mothers of Invention. For contractual reasons Frank Zappa credited Mark Volman and Howard Kaylan as Flo and Eddie. Flo and Eddie fronted the Mothers of Invention for about 18 months and their work was featured on two Mothers albums “Live at the Filmore East” and “Just another band from LA”. Flo and Eddie’s tenure with Zappa came to an end when Frank Zappa was pushed off the stage at London’s Rainbow Theatre in December 1971, and that version of the Mothers was broken up. This year (July 2020) Zappa Records have released a 50th Anniversary four CD box set of the Mothers of Invention featuring Flo and Eddie. Mark Volman and Howard Kaylan appeared in Frank Zappa’s movie “200 Motels”. I saw that version of the Mothers of Invention at Liverpool’s Mountford Hall in December 1971. Music is the Best.
